page.title: 05OLD BUCKENHAM HIGH SCHOOL
page.content: Old Buckenham High School was built in 1935. The Headmaster is Mr. Wainwright and his deputy is Mr. Bebb. There are 33 teachers and about 550 pupils on average. The 1st and 2nd years are registered in the Junior Block, the 3rd years in the New Block and the 4th and 5th around the main verandah. The ages are from eleven to sixteen and all teachers can teach more than one subject. The pupils are split into four houses named after famous Norfolk people, with their own house colour: Crome, which is red, Townshend, which is green, Borrow, which is blue and Coke, which is yellow. All the houses are family based which means that if a pupil has had a relative attend the school they will belong to the same house. There is a small swimming pool, five tennis courts and three football pitches.
